fit_and_scale(X: Dict[str, torch._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor], Y: Dict[str, torch._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor]) → Tuple[Dict[str, torch._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor], Dict[str, torch._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor]][source]

Fit the input (X) and output tensor (Y) finding the corresponding scaling factors for each features and than scales X and Y.

Parameters

  • X (dict[str,torch.tensor]) – Input dictionary.

  • Y (dict[str,torch.tensor]) – Input dictionary.

Returns

Returns a tuple with X and Y scaled.

Return type

class pkdnn.net.datamanager.database_reader(path: str, mesh_dim: List[int], inputs: List[str], database_inputs: Optional[List[str]] = None, Output: str = 'Dose', sample_per_case: int = 20000)[source]

Bases: object

class that reads and manage data from database

read_data(out_log_scale: bool = True, num_inp_files: Optional[int] = None, out_clip_values: Optional[List[float]] = None)[source]

read data in database folder

Parameters

  • out_log_scale (bool, optional) – Use log scale for output. Defaults to True.

  • num_inp_files (int, optional) – Take a random sub set of database of num_inp_files. If None, takes all the files present

  • out_clip_values (list[float], optional) – list clip values ([min clip, max clip]) for output. Defaults to None.

read_data_from_file(files: List[str], out_log_scale=True, out_clip_values: Optional[List[float]] = None)[source]

read data present in files list in the database folder

Parameters

  • files (list[str]) – list of files to be read, e.g., [‘0_10_1_1100’, ‘0_20_1_1100’, …]

  • out_log_Scale (bool, optional) – Use log scale for output. Defaults to True.

  • out_clip_values (list[float], optional) – list clip values ([min clip, max clip]) for output. Defaults to None.

pkdnn.net.pk_nn module

class pkdnn.net.pk_nn.pknn(layer_sizes: List[int])[source]

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Deep Neural Network for Point Kernel applications

forward(x)[source]

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

pkdnn.net.trainFunctions.to_device(tensors: torch._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor, scope)[source]
pkdnn.net.trainFunctions.train(scope, train_dataset: pkdnn.net.datamanager.Dataset, val_dataset: pkdnn.net.datamanager.Dataset, patience: int = 10, batch_size: int = 256, save_path: Optional[str] = None)[source]

_summary_

Parameters

  • scope – dictionary containing infos about training

  • train_dataset (Dataset) – dataset for training the NN

  • val_dataset (Dataset) – dataset used for validating the NN training

  • patience (int, optional) – number of epochs with no improvement on loss before stopping training. Defaults to 10.

  • batch_size (int, optional) – size of batch. Defaults to 256.

  • save_path (str, optional) – path in which save NN checkpoints. Defaults to None.

pkdnn.net.trainFunctions.train_model(model, train_dataset: pkdnn.net.datamanager.Dataset, val_dataset: pkdnn.net.datamanager.Dataset, optimizer, mixed_precision: bool = True, scheduler: bool = True, epochs: int = 100, batch_size: int = 256, patience: int = 10, device: int = 0, save_path: Optional[str] = None, loss=None, accuracy=None, lr_scheduler=None, **kwargs)[source]
